problem_text: (S. K. Grosser, W. N. Herfort). Does there exist an infinite compact p-group in which the centralizers of all elements are finite? Yu. N. Mukhin
answer: No, it does not exist, in view of the connection of this problem with the Restricted Burnside Problem (S. K. Grosser, W. N. Herfort, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc., 283, no. 1 (1984), 211–224) and because of the positive solution to the latter (E. I. Zel’manov, Math. USSR–Izv., 36 (1991), 41–60; Math. USSR–Sb., 72 (1992), 543–565).
